page.title: 10Recreation Crosthwaite'area'
page.content: There are several traditional {Recreations. Wrestling}has been taking place since Viking times. The combatants dress in a 'uniform' of elaborately embroidered black trunks, white long pants and vest.{Fishing, once a necessity, has become a sport with Salmon and Sea Trout being taken from the River Gilpin, although the quality and quantity of fish has deteriorated due to pollution.Another popular and sometimes necessary sport is{fell fox hunting.}The{Coniston Pack stays at local farms for several days controlling the fox population in order to protect the farm stock. {Shooting}was once only for live game but in recent years{clay pigeon {shooting}has become popular, as has {riding.}There is a{livery stable catering for full, part and grass liveries.
